item.title: Obsidian ePortfolio
item.description: First Year Only This guide applies to first year students only.

item.title: WordPress Basics
item.description: Second and Third Year Only This guide applies to second and third year students only.

item.title: Art isn't in the Tools
item.description: The Dilemma Assuming your end goal is to work in the games industry, or an adjacent creative sector, you may assume that studios and workplaces have rigid hard skill requirements (“you must know how to use this specific games engine, you must know how to use this specific program, you must know the ...

item.title: What is The Tech Stream
item.description: I strongly recommend reading Art isn’t in the Tools before this page, as it provides an important preface to understanding the purpose of the tech stream.

item.title: Technical Sessions
item.description: Each week, you will have what is broadly called a “Technical Session”. A three hour slot especially dedicated to technical learning and practice.

item.title: Technical Guides
item.description: techhub.wsagames.com/guides These guides can help to lead you through a particular concept, or will provide external resources.

item.title: Ad-Hoc Technical Support
item.description: Finally, you are free to ask for any technical support or advice from your technician! This can pertain to anything, and does not have to be related to your coursework or university projects: Ross Popovs (Digital Games Technician) In-Person: GDA Computer Suite On Slack By email: R.Popovs@soton.ac.uk...

item.title: Policy
item.description: Polite Notice A reminder that the upkeep of studios and other university spaces is a joint responsibility between all students (BA Games Design or otherwise) and staff.
